EXTRACTED VALUE: Simply too average for anything to stand out.
A breath of fresh air to see a vertical scrolling shooter that actually adapts to the players skill set.
This is one of those occasions where having your movement "on rails" actually helps extend the gameplay.
Not a game you'll play for hours on end, but good fun for short amounts of time.
A remake with its heart in the right place, but its mind in the gutter.
It's not innovative or surprising in any way, but the graphics and gameplay are enjoyable and the multiplayer is a fun option.
It's the same Tetris you've always loved. Only...busier. [June 2007, p.74]
Dropping five bucks on this arcade classic, which now has online support, is a pretty safe bet.
An astonishing game, one that needs to be celebrated again and again.
You should play Bejeweled 2. It's that simple. It's great, time-wasting fun worth having for 800 Microsoft Points, just because you can.
Open Season is one of this gaming season's most pleasant surprises - a game of a kids' CGI film that isn't a total sell out.
If you really enjoy SRPGs and don't have anything on your plate at the moment, Spectral Force 3 is a decent buy.
One of the best family games out there. [June 2008, p.78]
Ms. Pac-Man is still a joy to play. Simplicity itself, elegant, addictive, manic and somehow timeless.
For a mere five bucks, you'd be a fool not to download one of the greatest arcade games of all time. [Oct. 2006, p.72]
So while it falls short of greatness, Operation Darkness can content itself with being merely a fun game with an amazing premise.
